articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB and FADI TAWIL
articles.description: TYRE, Lebanon (AP) — Israeli jets Sunday launched an airstrike over a southern Lebanese border village, while troops shelled other border towns and villages still under Israeli control, Lebanon's state-run National News Agency reported.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit southern Lebanon, but tense ceasefire holds

articles.author: CARA ANNA
articles.description: LOWVILLE, N.Y. (AP) — Heavy snowfall and numbing temperatures kept parts of the U.S. in a deep freeze Sunday as the Thanksgiving holiday weekend draws to a close. Despite the Arctic-type weather, however, snowmobilers and skiers are reveling in their respective wintry terrains, and weather forecasters gave possible good news ahead of the NFL game in Buffalo.
articles.title: Heavy snow and numbing temperatures keep parts of the US in a deep freeze

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, SAMY MAGDY and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees said Sunday it is halting aid deliveries through the main cargo crossing into the war-ravaged Gaza Strip because of the threat of armed gangs who have looted convoys.
articles.title: UN halts aid shipments through Gaza's main crossing after looting. It blames the crisis on Israel

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump’s stunning announcement that he will nominate Kash Patel as FBI director sets the stage for a fresh round of turbulence at a law enforcement agency tasked with protecting the homeland and investigating federal crimes.
articles.title: Trump says he'll nominate Kash Patel as FBI director to remake the agency. Here's what happens next

articles.author: FATIMA HUSSEIN
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday threatened 100% tariffs against a bloc of nine nations if they act to undermine the U.S. dollar.His threat was directed at countries in the so-called BRIC alliance, which consists of Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa, Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran and the United Arab Emirates.
articles.title: Trump threatens 100% tariff on the BRIC bloc of nations if they act to undermine US dollar

articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — The Syrian military rushed reinforcements to the country's northwest and launched airstrikes on a major city Sunday in an attempt to push back insurgents who seized the country's largest city of Aleppo in a surprise offensive in recent days.
articles.title: Syrian military launches counterattacks in an attempt to halt insurgents' surprise advance

articles.author: MARK BANCHEREAU
articles.description: THIAROYE-SUR-MER, Senegal (AP) — Biram Senghor regularly pays his respects at a military cemetery in Thiaroye, a fishing village near Senegal’s capital Dakar, bowing in front of a different grave each time.
articles.title: Senegal demands answers as the West African country commemorates a French colonial massacre

articles.author: MOLLY QUELL
articles.description: THE HAGUE (AP) — The top United Nations court will take up the largest case in its history on Monday, when it opens two weeks of hearings into what countries worldwide are legally required to do to combat climate change and help vulnerable nations fight its devastating impact.
articles.title: A landmark climate change case will open at the top UN court as island nations fear rising seas

articles.author: MARIA CHENG and MARIA VERZA
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — It’s been called the closest the world has ever come to a vaccine against the AIDS virus.The twice-yearly shot was 100% effective in preventing HIV infections in a study of women, and results published Wednesday show it worked nearly as well in men.
articles.title: A twice-yearly shot could help end AIDS. But will it get to everyone who needs it?

articles.author: MIKE FITZPATRICK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In the long and storied history of New York City basketball, nobody wore it quite like Lou Carnesecca.The excitable St. John’s coach whose outlandish sweaters became an emblem of his team’s rousing Final Four run in 1985, died at 99 on Saturday, just a few weeks shy of his 100th birthday.
articles.title: Lou Carnesecca, Hall of Fame coach who led St. John's for 24 seasons, dies at 99
